questions.question_text: Two FortiGate units with NP6 processors form an active-active cluster. The cluster is doing security profile (UTM) inspection over all the user traffic. What statements are true regarding the sessions that the master unit is offloading to the slave unit for inspection? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
This looks quite wrong.
If offloading to secondary, NP6 secondary is used, so it answer is "BC".
Please check and explain

choices.A: They are accelerated by hardware in the master unit.
choices.C: They are accelerated by hardware in the slave unit.
choices.B: They are not accelerated by hardware in the master unit.
choices.D: They are not accelerated by hardware in the slave unit.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
D) because: NTurbo offloads firewall and NAT sessions from the FortiGate CPU to NP7 or NP6 network processors. B) because: The CP8 content processor provides the following services:Flow-based inspection (IPS, application control etc.) pattern matching acceleration.

Selected Answer: BD
for me is B & D

Selected Answer: CD
I think it is C/D
"
Sessions that require flow-based security features can be offloaded to NPx network processors if the FortiGate supports NTurbo."

questions.question_text: Which of the following Fortinet hardware accelerators can be used to offload flow-based antivirus inspection? (Choose two.)
What is IPsec Perfect Forwarding Secrecy (PFS)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A - it’s not in phase 1
B - It isn’t a common key, it’s a per session key that is calculated for each individual session
C - It is part of the key agreement
D - It’s not part of the SA

Ref = https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forward_secrecy

choices.B: A phase-2 setting that allows the recalculation of a new common secret key each time the session key expires.
choices.A: A phase-1 setting that allows the use of symmetric encryption.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are true regarding Local User Authentication? (Select all that apply.)

choices.C: Administrators can create an account for the user locally and specify the remote server to verify the password.
choices.D: Local users are for administration accounts only and cannot be used for identity policies.
choices.B: Two-factor authentication can be enabled on a per user basis.
choices.A: Local user authentication is based on usernames and passwords stored locally on the FortiGate unit.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
I was wrong, you can configure a local user to use a remote server for auth

Selected Answer: AB
C is incorrect, you can't use a remote server to auth a local user

questions.question_text: What FortiGate feature can be used to allow IPv6 clients to connect to IPv4 servers?
